title: Enhancing Depth Resolution of Multislice Ptychography with Data-Driven Prior and Regularization
content: Characterizing the 3-dimensional (3D) structure of bulk materials at nanoscale has been a critical challenge for materials science. Current approaches include focused ion beam-scanning electron microscopy (FIB-SEM), tilt-series and atom probe tomography (APT), and through-focus depth sectioning by scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM). Recently, multislice electron ptychography (MEP) has demonstrated unprecedented deep sub-angstrom lateral resolution along with depth-sectioning capabilities by incorporating a multislice formalism into the phase retrieval algorithm, enabling new possibilities for high-resolution volumetric characterization [1-2]. Unlike other techniques, multislice ptychography does not require a time-consuming or destructive data collection phase and can computationally reconstruct the 3D object potential slice-by-slice from a single 4-dimensional STEM (4D-STEM) dataset that is usually acquired within a few seconds (Fig. 1a). However, the depth resolution of MEP is limited to a few nanometers, or 100 times worse than the achievable lateral resolution. Here, we propose a data-driven approach to enhance the depth resolution of multislice ptychography by introducing prior knowledge of the specimen into the reconstruction workflow.
